intro: Turraea abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian Turraea, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia and parts of East Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas. Turraea abyssinica is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local communities.
